name: palm fruit bunch production | palm fruit bunch | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3370/documentation

This dataset represents the production of palm fresh fruit bunches in Colombia. All the exchanges are calculated per kg of fresh fruit bunch (wet mass) and are based on field data from the main industrial oil palm cultivation area in Colombia. In Colombia, the average life span of oil palms is 25 years, with an average annual productivity of 18.3 tons per hectare. The inventory includes the use of mineral and organic fertilizers, pesticides, irrigation, machinery and the field emissions from the fertilizer and pesticide application. Further, also the emissions related to land use changes are considered.;This activity was adapted to include the country specific average land use change (LUC) emissions according 2nd edition of the Quantis-modified tool developed by Blonk Consultants "WFLDB-adapted-Blonk 2014 direct-land-use-change-assessment-tool_2015-05-18a.xlsx", tab. "Country known & land use unknown". The size of the emission depends on (i) the relative crop expansion in the country during the last 20 years and (ii) the corresponding, country specific land transformations. The current results are based on the average FAOSTAT data (harvested area) of 2009-2011 and 1989-1991. The weighted average is used which takes into account relative difference in crop expansion into primary forest, secondary forest, grassland, perennial and annual land.

From preparing the land and planting of oil palms.


This dataset ends with the harvesting of palm fresh fruit bunches and includes the land preparation (incl. land use change emissions) and the crop management (fertilizers, application of empty fruit bunches, pesticides, and machinery).
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0126:Growing of oleaginous fruits

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modeled for Colombia based on field data from the main oil palm cultivation areas in the North (9"276 ha, representing 8.7% of the total oil palm plantations in Northern Colombia), the Center (5"850 ha, representing 6.7% of the total oil palm plantations in Central Colombia) and the East (12"445.40 ha, representing 10.3 % of the total oil palm plantations in East Colombia). Overall, the dataset represents 27"571 ha of oil palm cultivation in Colombia out of totally 336"956 ha (8%).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Field data. The main oil palm cultivation areas are located in East (121"135 ha), North (106"635 ha) and Central (87’525 ha) Colombia, while the plantations in the West (21"661 ha) are decreasing due to pests. Out of the total area under oil palm cultivation, 10 plantations (27"571 ha, 8% of the total area) were randomly selected for the LCI data collection. The average LCI values from the 10 plantations were used (weighted average by size of the plantation) and further validated/complemented by literature data.

exchanges.description: Fresh fruit bunches from Colombian oil palm plantations with a moisture content of 47%.

flow.name: palm fruit bunch
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0126:Growing of oleaginous fruits

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of palm fruit bunch is calculated to be circa 5.76E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: "[sulfonyl]urea-compound", "[thio]carbamate-compound", "acetamide-anillide-compound, unspecified", "benzimidazole-compound", "bipyridylium-compound", "boric oxide", "cyclic N-compound", "dithiocarbamate-compound", "ethoxylated alcohol (AE11)", "glyphosate", "organophosphorus-compound, unspecified", "pesticide, unspecified", "phthalimide-compound", "pyrethroid-compound", "triazine-compound, unspecified". The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.15E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Calculated value: Based on the field visits of palm oil plantations in Colombia, 27.5 % of the plantations are established on shurbland, 22.5 % on grassland, 3.7% on arable land, 0.3% on peat land, 0.2% on primary forest and 45.8% were already palm oil plantations. Palm oil plantations are considered as intensively used forests (tree cover > 15%, even-aged stands and average stand age <30 years.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of "palm fruit bunch" is calculated to be circa 1.98E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: "ammonium nitrate, as N", "dolomite", "magnesium oxide", "nitrogen fertiliser, as N", "phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5", "potassium chloride, as K2O", "potassium sulfate, as K2O", "urea, as N". The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 3.97E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Calculated value: Palm oil plantations are considered as intensively used forests  (tree cover > 15%, even-aged stands and average stand age <30 years. The amount of transformed land is calculated by dividing of the area (1 ha) by the lifetime capacity (lifetime [years] times the average productivity [ton/ha/year]).
